reviewText: I knew I would LOVE and enjoy this! Oh, the fond memories of watching this before going to the (mostly cold) bus stop! Eating breakfast and watching this at 6 AM was the best! I still have memories of the episodes or most parts. Although, i'm not entirely sure how many I saw in those years... I've only been through the first disc. But, I definitely remembered the sloths! Ha. For some odd reason, I had a different memory of Sonic's voice. But, that's okay. Tails was always my favorite. I can't wait to save up for the other volumes!

reviewText: 21 years ago, a video game was released starring a heroic, fiesty, blue hedgehog. His name was Sonic and quickly became a video game icon. A year later, a sequel was released featuring the debut of his trusty sidekick, Tails and again became a hit. Another year later, in the Fall of 1993, as a result of being so popular, Sonic finally got his own cartoon; Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog! As a fan of Sonic, I gotta say out of all the cartoons, this is the best one! It has a perfect mix of action and comedy, a wonderful and faithful adaptation of the first 2 Sonic games, and really captures the essence of Sonic. AOSTH Sonic is my favorite Sonic, because he's heroic, smart, and wacky! He's a complete screwball in this one and I love it (like a mix of Mickey, Bugs, Woody Woodpecker, and classic Daffy. There's not better Sonic than a screwball Sonic)! Take it from me, AOSTH is true Sonic spirit and quirky, smart, and fun for everyone and should you buy it on DVD, get the Shout! Factory releases since they did a fantastic job! With that I'm up, over, and gone!
summary: Some call it the other Sonic show, I call it the best Sonic show!

reviewText: Many fans of the Saturday morning Sonic cartoon are, in my mind, overly-critical of this syndicated, weekday show. Sure, it was somewhat childish compared to the more serious SatAM show, but that was part of the charm. I don't always want to watch a cartoon that's a serious tour de force; Sometimes I just want to watch a cartoon, and this one is great fun. Sonic and the badniks have a great cat-and-mouse routine going, with a nice sense of humor throughout. I know it's Looney Tuney, but it's fun.
Title: N/A

reviewText: For those of you who don't know, there have thus far been no less than four Sonic the Hedgehog cartoons: Sonic the Hedgehog, also known as SatAM; the Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog, also known as AoSTH; Sonic Underground; and Sonic X. I'm familiar with all four of them, as well as the histories behind them, so trust me when I say that this is the worst of all four. It was originally slated to be THE Sonic cartoon, but it sucked so badly that some of the Powers That Be decided to reject it and create something better, which eventually became SatAM. The Sonic comic books at the time started out being much like AoSTH, but eventually turned toward the more dramatic, intelligent, character-driven storytelling of SatAM. Years later, when Sonic Underground was being made, the Powers That Be also recognized the infinite superiority of SatAM over AoSTH, and accordingly made Underground more like the former than like the latter. As a result, it ended up being second best (arguably first, even) of the four. Sonic X was little more than an English-dubbed version of a Japanese show, the sole purpose of which was to serve as a half-hour advertisement for the Sonic games for the Dreamcast; although it was quite boring and completely devoid of substance, it was not as excruciatingly painful to watch as AoSTH, it remained popular enough to last a half-dozen seasons, and it even paid token tribute to characters like Knuckles and Amy, placing it (in my opinion) third out of four, though you might find AoSTH more entertaining than Sonic X if you are amused by really bad attempts at humor.Network executives, comic book-writers, and fans agree: SatAM and Underground are better than AoSTH.
summary: Worst of all four Sonic cartoons

reviewerName: Ryan Sil. (Creator of Dynamite Alex for Andro...
reviewText: Alright. I will admit: The show isn't the best out there. The design is so extremely wacky it's ridiculous at times. The animation could be said the same thing (Robotnik's head was sideways while he was running in one scene), but in the end, it's a cartoon show based off the popular Sega game series...and it's funny.While it can be pretty ridiculous, that's partly why it's humorous. You won't believe how weird the storylines are ("I created a robot to destroy all music!"), and you gotta love how Sonic actually disguises himself to trick Robotnik's two minions (Scratch and Grounder) most of the time. It's eye-rolling to see the situations Sonic and Tails could get into though sometimes, while other times, they are laughable.Did I forget to mention that Sonic has a moral to teach at the end of every episode? Even those are weird, but of course, we expect the usual messages as well.The show as a whole sounds really stupid, but you know what? It could appeal to many in a strange, but fun way.It's ENJOYABLY stupid. And that's why I love this more than the Super Mario Bros Super Show.Besides, with a company like Sega and Sonic voiced by the likes of Jaleel White (Urkel from Family Matters), the show has great production value.
summary: Silly fun that is unmatched by other game-based shows

reviewText: I'm glad this is basically an average animated cartoon. Nintendo tried live-action with Mario... It made their Zelda cartoon series feel like a mircale. Sonic's cartoon series did a wacky job, but that just makes it more amusing. Eggman had a mama , Tails grew 50 ft tall, and Sonic got turned into a baby. The series also set a new level for stupidness. To keep Tails safe, Sonic makes Tails stay in a ball pit in EGGMAN'S casino. At the end of each episode Sonic tries to teach safety lessons... one of them explained in great detail what happens when you climb into a dryer. I highly recommend this if you want a Sonic cartoon, every other one seems to be killing Sonic.
